confirm.deleteSupplementaryMessage:
Are you sure you want to delete the supplementary file "{{ fileName }}"?

This file will be permanently removed from your filesystem.
confirm.deleteOnlyFormatMessage:
Are you sure you want to delete "{{ fileName }}"?

This is the ONLY book format file for this book. After deletion, the book will have no readable content.

Consider using "Delete Book & All Files" instead to completely remove the book.

This file will be permanently removed from your filesystem.
confirm.deletePrimaryFormatMessage:
Are you sure you want to delete "{{ fileName }}"?

This is currently the PRIMARY format for this book. After deletion, an alternative format will become the new primary.

This file will be permanently removed from your filesystem.
confirm.deleteAltFormatMessage:
Are you sure you want to delete "{{ fileName }}"?

This file will be permanently removed from your filesystem.
confirm.deleteBookMessage:
Are you sure you want to delete "{{ title }}"?

This will permanently remove the book record from your library.

This action cannot be undone.
confirm.deleteBookAllFilesMessage:
Are you sure you want to delete "{{ title }}"?

This will permanently remove the book record AND all associated files from your filesystem.

This action cannot be undone.

sidecar.title: Sidecar Metadata
sidecar.description: View and manage sidecar metadata files (.metadata.json) associated with this book. Sidecar files provide portable metadata that travels with the book file.
sidecar.exportTooltip: Export current book metadata to a sidecar (.metadata.json) file
sidecar.importTooltip: Import metadata from the sidecar file into BookLore
sidecar.noSidecarDescription: No sidecar metadata file exists for this book. Use the Export button to create one.

toast.exportSuccessDetail: Sidecar metadata file has been created.
toast.exportFailedDetail: Failed to create sidecar metadata file.
toast.importSuccessDetail: Metadata has been imported from sidecar file.
toast.importFailedDetail: Failed to import metadata from sidecar file.

manager.title: Metadata Manager
manager.description: Organize, merge, split, rename, and standardize authors, genres, moods, and tags across your library.
manager.writeToFileWarning: Important: If 'Write to file' is enabled in settings, operations will modify all relevant files. For libraries with thousands of books, disable 'Write to file' before using this feature to prevent performance issues and potential data corruption.
manager.singleMergeHowItWorks:
How it works:
• Enter the standardized value you want all selected items to merge into
• All books with any of the selected {{ type }} will be updated to use this single value

Example: When merging "En", "English", "en-US"
• Enter "English" → All books will have their {{ singular }} merged to "English"

Note: Each book can only have one {{ singular }}, so only enter one target value.
manager.multiMergeHowItWorks:
How it works:
• Enter a single value to merge all selected {{ type }} into one
• Enter multiple values separated by commas to split into multiple {{ type }}

Example: When merging/splitting "Sci-Fi", "SciFi", "Science Fiction"
• Merge: Enter "Science Fiction" → All books get one standardized tag
• Split: Enter "Science Fiction, Sci-Fi" → All books get both the formal name and common abbreviation
manager.processingNote: This process may take longer if "Write to file" is enabled in the settings.
manager.singleRenameHowItWorks:
How it works:
• Enter a new value to rename this {{ singular }}

Note: Each book can only have one {{ singular }}, so splitting into multiple values is not allowed.
manager.multiRenameHowItWorks:
How it works:
• Enter a single value to rename the {{ singular }}
• Enter multiple values separated by commas to split into multiple {{ type }}

Example: When renaming/splitting "Mystery & Detective"
• Rename: Enter "Mystery" → Renames to just "Mystery"
• Split: Enter "Mystery, Detective" → Splits into two separate {{ type }}
manager.renameProcessingNote: This process may take some time if "Write to file" is enabled in settings.
manager.deleteWarning: You are about to delete {{ count }} {{ type }}:
manager.deleteItemRemoved: The {{ singular }} will be removed from all affected books

advancedFetchOptions.firstPriorityTooltip: First choice - always tried first for this field
advancedFetchOptions.secondPriorityTooltip: Second choice - used if 1st priority doesn't have data
advancedFetchOptions.thirdPriorityTooltip: Third choice - used if 1st and 2nd priorities don't have data
advancedFetchOptions.fourthPriorityTooltip: Last fallback option - only used if 1st, 2nd, and 3rd priorities fail or are empty
advancedFetchOptions.enableFieldTooltip: Enable this field during metadata fetch
advancedFetchOptions.providerSpecificDescription: These fields are unique to specific providers and cannot have custom priority settings. Use the checkboxes to enable/disable fetching these fields.
advancedFetchOptions.replaceModeTooltip: Controls how fetched metadata replaces existing values. 'Replace Missing Only' only fills empty fields, 'Replace All Fields' overwrites existing values.
advancedFetchOptions.updateCoversTooltip: Fetch and update new book cover images
advancedFetchOptions.mergeGenresTooltip: Combine new genres with existing ones
advancedFetchOptions.manualReviewTooltip: Review and approve metadata changes before saving

toast.providerRequiredDetail: At least one provider (P1-P4) must be selected for each enabled book field.
